001package net.tvburger.jdl.model;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.*;
004
005import java.util.ArrayList;
006import java.util.Arrays;
007import java.util.Iterator;
008import java.util.List;
009
010/**
011 * Represents a data set. A data set consist of samples. A sample has inputs (e.g. features or signals) and
012 * corresponding expected outputs.
013 *
014 * @param samples the samples to hold in this data set
015 */
016@DomainObject
017@Composition
018public record DataSet(List<Sample> samples) implements Iterable<DataSet.Sample> {
019
020    /**
021     * Interface to load a data set.
022     */
023    @FactoryMethod
024    public interface Loader {
025
026        /**
027         * The loaded data set.
028         *
029         * @return the loaded data set
030         */
031        DataSet load();
032
033    }
034
035    /**
036     * The sample represents a single input for an estimation function and the corresponding expected outputs.
037     *
038     * @param features      the inputs for this sample
039     * @param targetOutputs the expected outputs for the given inputs
040     * @see EstimationFunction
041     */
042    @DomainObject
043    @ValueObject
044    public record Sample(float[] features, float[] targetOutputs) {
045
046        /**
047         * Utility method to create a sample
048         *
049         * @param feature      the inputs for the sample
050         * @param targetOutput the expected outputs for the sample
051         * @return the sample
052         */
053        @StaticFactory
054        public static DataSet.Sample of(float[] feature, float[] targetOutput) {
055            return new DataSet.Sample(feature, targetOutput);
056        }
057
058        /**
059         * Returns the number of features in this sample.
060         * <p>
061         * The feature count corresponds to the dimensionality of the
062         * input vector (the <b>arity</b> of the function being trained or
063         * estimated). This is typically the number of independent variables
064         * or input attributes provided by the dataset.
065         * </p>
066         *
067         * @return the number of input features in this sample
068         */
069        public int featureCount() {
070            return features.length;
071        }
072
073        /**
074         * Returns the number of target outputs in this sample.
075         * <p>
076         * The target count corresponds to the dimensionality of the
077         * expected output vector (the <b>co-arity</b> of the function being
078         * trained or estimated). This is typically the number of dependent
079         * variables, labels, or regression targets provided by the dataset.
080         * </p>
081         *
082         * @return the number of target outputs in this sample
083         */
084        public int targetCount() {
085            return targetOutputs.length;
086        }
087
088        /**
089         * Checks whether this sample is compatible with the given estimation function.
090         * <p>
091         * A dataset is considered compatible if:
092         * <ul>
093         *   <li>its feature count equals the function's {@code arity()}, and</li>
094         *   <li>its target count equals the function's {@code coArity()}.</li>
095         * </ul>
096         *
097         * @param estimationFunction the estimation function to compare against
098         * @return {@code true} if the dataset matches the function's input/output schema;
099         * {@code false} otherwise
100         */
101        public boolean isCompatibleWith(EstimationFunction estimationFunction) {
102            return estimationFunction.arity() == featureCount() && estimationFunction.coArity() == targetCount();
103        }
104
105        /**
106         * {@inheritDoc}
107         */
108        @Override
109        public boolean equals(Object o) {
110            if (this == o) return true;
111            if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
112            Sample sample = (Sample) o;
113            return Arrays.equals(features, sample.features) && Arrays.equals(targetOutputs, sample.targetOutputs);
114        }
115
116        /**
117         * {@inheritDoc}
118         */
119        @Override
120        public int hashCode() {
121            int result = Arrays.hashCode(features);
122            result = 31 * result + Arrays.hashCode(targetOutputs);
123            return result;
124        }
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Create a new data set for the given samples, where samples can't added or removed.
129     *
130     * @param sample the samples to put in the data set
131     * @return the data set
132     */
133    @StaticFactory
134    public static DataSet of(Sample... sample) {
135        if (sample.length > 0) {
136            Sample firstSample = sample[0];
137            for (int i = 1; i < sample.length; i++) {
138                if (firstSample.featureCount() != sample[i].featureCount()
139                        || firstSample.targetCount() != sample[i].targetCount()) {
140                    throw new IllegalArgumentException("Sample " + i + " has wrong size!");
141                }
142            }
143        }
144        return new DataSet(List.of(sample));
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * Creates a new empty data set
149     */
150    @StaticFactory
151    public static DataSet create() {
152        return new DataSet(new ArrayList<>());
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Creates a new data set that contains only a subset of samples. Useful for cutting a single data set into
157     * a training, validation, and test set.
158     *
159     * @param fromIndex the fromIndex inclusive
160     * @param toIndex   the toIndex exclusive
161     * @return the new data set containing only a subset of the samples
162     * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the indexes are not properly given
163     */
164    public DataSet subset(int fromIndex, int toIndex) {
165        return new DataSet(samples.subList(fromIndex, toIndex));
166    }
167
168    /**
169     * Adds the given sample to the data set
170     *
171     * @param sample the sample to add
172     */
173    public void addSample(Sample sample) {
174        if (!samples.isEmpty()) {
175            if (sample.featureCount() != samples.getFirst().featureCount()
176                    || sample.targetCount() != samples.getFirst().targetCount()) {
177                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Sample has wrong size!");
178            }
179        }
180        samples.add(sample);
181    }
182
183    /**
184     * Adds the given sample to the data set
185     *
186     * @param features      the inputs for the sample
187     * @param targetOutputs the expected outputs for the sample
188     */
189    public void addSample(float[] features, float[] targetOutputs) {
190        addSample(DataSet.Sample.of(features, targetOutputs));
191    }
192
193    /**
194     * Removes the first occurrence of the sample of the data set. No-op if not present.
195     *
196     * @param sample the sample to remove
197     */
198    public void removeSample(Sample sample) {
199        samples.remove(sample);
200    }
201
202    /**
203     * Returns the number of features in this data set.
204     * <p>
205     * The feature count corresponds to the dimensionality of the
206     * input vector (the <b>arity</b> of the function being trained or
207     * estimated). This is typically the number of independent variables
208     * or input attributes provided by the dataset.
209     * </p>
210     *
211     * @return the number of input features in this sample
212     */
213    public int getFeatureCount() {
214        if (samples.isEmpty()) {
215            throw new IllegalStateException("No samples!");
216        }
217        return samples.getFirst().featureCount();
218    }
219
220    /**
221     * Returns the number of target outputs in this data set.
222     * <p>
223     * The target count corresponds to the dimensionality of the
224     * expected output vector (the <b>co-arity</b> of the function being
225     * trained or estimated). This is typically the number of dependent
226     * variables, labels, or regression targets provided by the dataset.
227     * </p>
228     *
229     * @return the number of target outputs in this sample
230     */
231    public int getTargetCount() {
232        if (samples.isEmpty()) {
233            throw new IllegalStateException("No samples!");
234        }
235        return samples.getFirst().targetCount();
236    }
237
238    /**
239     * {@inheritDoc}
240     */
241    @Override
242    public Iterator<Sample> iterator() {
243        return samples().listIterator();
244    }
245
246    /**
247     * Checks whether this dataset is compatible with the given estimation function.
248     * <p>
249     * A dataset is considered compatible if:
250     * <ul>
251     *   <li>its feature count per sample equals the function's {@code arity()}, and</li>
252     *   <li>its target count per sample equals the function's {@code coArity()}.</li>
253     * </ul>
254     *
255     * @param estimationFunction the estimation function to compare against
256     * @return {@code true} if the dataset matches the function's input/output schema;
257     * {@code false} otherwise
258     */
259    public boolean isCompatibleWith(EstimationFunction estimationFunction) {
260        return samples.isEmpty() || samples.getFirst().isCompatibleWith(estimationFunction);
261    }
262
263    /**
264     * Ensures that this {@link DataSet} is compatible with the given
265     * {@link EstimationFunction}.
266     *
267     * <p>
268     * Compatibility typically means that the structure of the dataset
269     * (e.g., feature dimensionality, output dimensionality) matches
270     * the requirements of the estimation function. This method is a
271     * guard to prevent training or evaluation with mismatched models
272     * and datasets.
273     * </p>
274     *
275     * <p>
276     * If the dataset is compatible, this method returns the current
277     * instance for fluent chaining. If it is not compatible, an
278     * {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown.
279     * </p>
280     *
281     * @param estimationFunction the estimation function to check against
282     * @return this dataset, if compatible
283     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the dataset is not compatible
284     *                                  with the given estimation function
285     */
286    public DataSet compatible(EstimationFunction estimationFunction) {
287        if (!isCompatibleWith(estimationFunction)) {
288            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Incompatible estimation function!");
289        }
290        return this;
291    }
292
293    /**
294     * Returns the number of samples in the data set.
295     *
296     * @return the number of samples in the data set
297     */
298    public int size() {
299        return samples.size();
300    }
301
302    /**
303     * Returns true if there are no samples in the data set
304     *
305     * @return true if empty
306     */
307    public boolean isEmpty() {
308        return samples.isEmpty();
309    }
310}
